Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which the home-mortgage deduction benefits people making a quarter-million dollars or more a year.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that 73 percent of the deduction goes to people in the specified income bracket.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the home-mortgage deduction is widely thought to be a middle-class benefit, which may not be universally true.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the distribution of benefits from the deduction, such as the fact that wealthier homeowners tend to have more expensive houses and therefore pay more in interest.
